tool_description: PDFCipher is a light-weight, yet powerful API that encrypts PDFs from a file url or Base-64 string.
name: PDFCipher
title: PDFCipher

api_list.name: https://pdfcipher.azurewebsites.net/Encrypt
api_list.description:
Use this endpoint to encrypt PDFs from a file URL or base-64 string. 

Parameters: 

Source:
A valid URL to a PDF file or a base-64 encoded string

Encode:
Set to true to return a base-64 encoded string.  When set to false a file (Media Type:  application/pdf) will be returned.

User Password: 
Password to encrypt the document limiting document capabilities such as  modify, print, copy and form filling. 

Owner Password: 
Password giving full access to a document. 

No Print: 
Restrict printing capabilities from users opening the document with the user password. 

No Copy: 
Restrict text copying capability from users opening the document with the user password. 

No Modify: 
Restrict editing capability from users opening the document with the user password. 

No Interactive: 
Restrict form filling capability from users opening the document with the user password. 

Result File Name: 
When parameter, "encode" is set to false, this filename will be used for the file download link.  If no filename is specified, a filename will be generated.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://pdfcipher1.p.rapidapi.com/Encrypt"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "pdfcipher1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
